Lord Bendtner otkrio kako je vređao Vengera: Svašta sam mu rekao, sutradan sam se izvinjavao
Nikad nije umeo da kontroliše emocije

05 Nov 2019

Talenat nije bio sporan, glava jeste. Sa godinama je to shvatio i sam Niklas Bentner, koji je u novoj knjizi “Druga strana“ otkrio i kako je jednom prilikom najstrašnije izvređao dugogodišnjeg Arsenalovog trenera Arsena Vengera.
Incident se zbio 2013. Lord Bentner je shvatio da nije prvi Vengerov pik i imao je obećanje da će ga klub pustiti u Kristal Palas. Međutim, kako poslednjeg dana prelaznog roka klub nije uspeo da pronađe drugog napadača Venger mu je u telefonskom razgovoru saopštio da nema ništa od posla.“Bilo je oko 20 sati na sati kad me Venger zove. Prelazi odmah na stvar: Nismo uspeli da dovedemo napadača kojeg smo hteli. Tako da moraš da budeš rezerva. To je tvoj posao u narednoj sezoni“, saopštio je Venger danskom napadaču.
A on nikad nije umeo da se kontroliše. Mada je probao...“Spustio sam slušalicu. Pogledao Toma (Bruksa, menadžera), koji je slegao ramenima. Onda sam ga opet pozvao. Rekao sam mu svašta, mnogo ružnih stvari. Recimo da je s...nja i drk...ja. ’Ne volimo se više’, završio sam. ’Najbolje bi za sve bilo da se rastanemo’. Pokušavao sam i dalje da se izborim za odlazak“.
Međutim, nije uspelo. A onda dođe jutro...“Nisam oka sklopio te večeri. I u utorak ujutru vozim, idem direktno kod šefa u kancelariju i zakucam na vrata. ’Morate da mi oprostite na ponašanju od sinoć’, počeo sam. Zaista nisam želeo da budem na Vengerovoj listi neprijatelja. Morten Olsen (bivši selektor Danske, prim.aut) i Venger su verovatno dvojica koje nikako nisam hteo da razočaram“.
Te sezone Bentner je u Premijer ligi odigrao 157 minuta, još četiri u Ligi šampiona. Sledećeg leta je kao slobodan igrač otišao u Volfzburg.
(FOTO: Reuters)

Lord Bendtner revealed he was insulting Wenger: I told him everything, I apologized the next day
He never knew how to control emotions

05 Nov 2019

The talent was not in dispute, the head did. Over the years, so did Niklas Bentner himself, who also revealed in a new book, The Other Side, that he once outraged Arsenal coach Arsene Wenger on one occasion.
The incident happened in 2013. Lord Bentner realized he was not Wenger's first pick and had a promise that the club would release him to Crystal Palace. However, as the club failed to find another striker on the last day of the deadline, Wenger told him in a telephone call that he had nothing to do. ”It was about 8 pm when Wenger called me. It goes straight to the point: We couldn't get the attacker we wanted. So you have to be a backup. That's your job next season, "Wenger told the Danish striker.
And he never knew how to control himself. Although he tried ... ”I hung up. He looked at Tom (Brooks, the manager), who shrugged. Then I called him again. I told him all sorts, many ugly things. Let's say she's ... her and her ... I'm me. 'We don't love each other anymore', I'm done. 'It would be best if we all parted'. I kept trying to fight to leave. "
However, it did not work. And then the morning comes ... "I didn't close my eyes that evening. And on a Tuesday morning, I drive, go straight to the boss's office and knock on the door. 'You have to forgive me for my behavior last night', I began. I really didn't want to be on Wenger's list of enemies. Morten Olsen (former coach of Denmark, cf.aut) and Wenger are probably two that I never wanted to disappoint. "
That season, Bentner played 157 minutes in the Premier League, four more in the Champions League. The following summer he went to Wolfsburg as a free agent.
(PHOTO: Reuters)
